title: How has pet culture changed in your country?

korean: 한국의 반려동물 문화가 최근 몇 년 사이 정말 많이 변한 것 같아.
예전엔 그냥 애완동물이라고 불렀는데, 요즘은 반려동물이라는 말을 써.
1인 가구가 늘면서 반려동물 키우는 사람도 엄청 늘었어.
강아지나 고양이뿐만 아니라 다양한 동물들을 키우는 추세야.
동물 병원도 정말 많이 생겼고, 의료 수준도 높아졌어.
펫 카페나 애견 동반 가능한 식당들도 많이 생겼어.
반려동물 용품 시장도 엄청 커져서 다양한 제품들이 나오고 있어.
펫보험 같은 상품도 생기고, 반려동물 관련 직업도 다양해졌어.
하지만 유기동물 문제도 심각해져서 입양 문화가 중요해지고 있어.
전체적으로 책임감 있게 키우는 문화가 자리 잡고 있는 것 같아.
english: Pet culture in Korea seems to have, like, really changed a lot in recent years.
Before, we just called them pets, but these days we use the term 'companion animals'.
Many people think of them as family members.
As single-person households increased, the number of people raising pets has also, you know, increased tremendously.
It's a trend to raise not just dogs or cats but various animals.
Many animal hospitals have appeared, and the medical level has also risen.
Pet cafés and restaurants that allow dogs have also appeared a lot.
The pet product market has also grown tremendously, and various products are coming out.
Products like pet insurance have also appeared, and pet-related jobs have diversified.
However, the problem of abandoned animals has also become serious, so adoption culture is becoming important.
Pet etiquette education is also being emphasized.
Overall, it seems a culture of raising pets responsibly is, like, taking root.
